benchmark_details.name: MMRefine (MultiModal Refinement)
benchmark_details.overview: MMRefine is a MultiModal Refinement benchmark designed to evaluate the error refinement capabilities of Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs) across various scenarios and error types.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To systematically evaluate the refinement capabilities of MLLMs across the entire refinement process.

methodology.calculation: RefScore is calculated as RS - FD, where RS is the proportion of corrected solutions and FD is the proportion of uncorrected solutions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher RefScore indicates better refinement performance.
methodology.validation: The effectiveness of MMRefine was validated through experiments with various MLLMs.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: MMRefine is released under the CC BY-SA 4.0 license.
